post.body: Whew. Glad to know that. Was quite worried there.
Maybe. I'm thinking it's something else, though. Thinking it's just related to people not liking changes to comfort zones
Just picked a set of V-Drums off of there. We do love our Craigslist. Just watch the scammers. They're nasty.
Yes. Been there. This is different. More like the CEO not trusting the executive team that a Dev Mgr not trusting devs for estimates
What's killing me is the pushback is based on false assumptions. I know it seems scary, but if what you're doing doesn't work...
It would be nice. We were in NYC over the weekend for anniv. and vaca - it was nice to be away from it all
(Says the guy whose looking at it being 80 degrees outside right now)
@UMLGuy I've also heard the toungue is a fantastic conductor of body heat to frozen metal. You'll have it unstuck in no time!
@scottcreynolds When do you all want to talk about the TDD Firestarter?
Congrats on the new baby girl! What a great Christmas present!
Gotcha. We live back in Beacon Woods. Small world! Course, I have to drive to Westshore every day, so I envy your commute. :)
Surely you have garbage cans that have lids, eh? Seen plenty of people sled with those.
Then you are right up the road from me! We're around Fivay and Little - where are you all?
When you said developers, I thought you meant software devs, and I was all excited about getting lots of free cash. Or something.
Also, Super Mario in 14kb of Javascript: http://tinyurl.com/3ugnk4
http://www.testdrivenjavascript.com, http://tinyurl.com/72xs3o and JQuery are good starts
Sounds like it isn't registered with IIS. It will block file extensions from being served when it doesn't know it
Battling that now. "We did agile at my last place, but never like this! I had 3 mos to design - why do I have to deliver weekly?!"
And what that burn out leads to is the proliferation of "Agile sucks! TDD Sucks! I did it at my last place and it sucks!" I see.
Good point. It's really a shame, because when they do get the pain, they either adapt, or run away talking about how bad UTs are
Now I just need to get the crazy idea of moving from Tampa (where it was 80 degrees today) to NYC (where...it wasn't)
Saw two shows - Spamalot (with Clay Aiken) and In The Heights - which I /highly/ recommend. Got to eat at some great places as well.
BTW - NYC was awesome. We had a great time this weekend.
*WAVES ARMS* Umm - I think someone's hacked the @fitnesse account. I d'd @unclebobmartin already...
Team /can/ do it - because proposal was made around their capabilities and close discussion with them
IOW, proposal is sent out, and exec shoots down because he says team can't handle it - without talking to team, and with team on CC
Assuming that the thing in point you are refuting by saying that your team can't possibly do it - even though they say they can
In other words, if all your senior people said that something was possible, what would make you say, "No - all of you are wrong"
Ok tweets - trying not to flip the bozo bit. What would make a manager not believe what his team (that he trusts) is telling him
Pushing team to switch from 4->1wk iterations that they are basically doing now. Getting lots of pushback back from mgmt. Mtg invites sent.
RT @martinfowler: Will DSLs allow business people to write software rules without programmers? http://tinyurl.com/6bque8
Much accomplished today - garage clean. Tomorrow to Orlando for lunch with @unclebobmartin and pick up a bike Target decided not to send
Hey, what are you doing for CI? Oh, you are using TFS instead of SVN? BURN HIM!!! BURN HIM!!! HERETIC!!! BURRRRNNN HIM!!!!
Pondering giving up development and just starting a band. The problem is the travel isn't much better.
Ooh. actually wired up some Obj-C with the IPhone app. Sooo different, but I think I like it. Reminds me of what little I know of Smalltalk.
Finished my first IPhone application. Well, if dragging a label onto a form and saying "Build and Run" counts for anything
Sorry, listening /to/ Tool. Good dev music.
Listening tool, hacking away at some iPhone dev stuff. Hoping that the iPhone dev isn't really going to reinstall all 4GB of XCode
That's refreshing - Delta eliminated the fuel surcharges for aware tix it put on because of high fuel prices - http://tinyurl.com/74fg2k
Wife smells like oranges after cutting and peeling a ton to make orange marmalade. Mmmm. Marmalade.
